P.title: Will the United States recognize the Islamic Emirate of Afghanistan before 2030?
P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve positively if before 01-01-2030, reliable media sources report that the United States of America has recognized the Islamic Emirate of Afghanistan

Q_given_P.title: Conditional on the United States recognizing the Islamic Emirate of Afghanistan before 2030, will Israel recognize the Islamic Emirate of Afghanistan before 2030?
Q_given_P.body:
Resolution Criteria for the condition: This question will resolve positively if before 01-01-2030, reliable media sources report that the United States of America has recognized the Islamic Emirate of Afghanistan.

Resolution Criteria for the outcome: This question will resolve positively if before 01-01-2030, reliable media sources report that Israel has recognized the Islamic Emirate of Afghanistan.

R_given_P_and_Q.title: Given that both the United States and Israel recognize the Islamic Emirate of Afghanistan before 2030, will Saudi Arabia normalize relations with Israel by 2031 if Iran does not get a nuclear bomb by then?
R_given_P_and_Q.body:
Suppose the following is true: Both the United States and Israel recognize the Islamic Emirate of Afghanistan before 01-01-2030, as reported by reliable media sources. Then, will Saudi Arabia normalize relations with Israel by 2031 if Iran does not get a nuclear bomb by then?

Resolution Criteria for P: This question will resolve positively if before 01-01-2030, reliable media sources report that both the United States of America and Israel have recognized the Islamic Emirate of Afghanistan.

Resolution Criteria for Q: If the Iran nuke question resolves negatively (i.e., the Iranian Regime credibly states it has a nuclear weapon or a weapon test, as judged by media reports), then this question will resolve positively if at least five reliable media outlets report that the State of Israel is legally recognized by the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia before 2031-01-01, and negatively otherwise. Recognition is generally considered valid if it is declared by law, or declared through a large international body such as the United Nations. If the Iran nuke question resolves positively or ambiguously, this question resolves ambiguously.

P_and_Q_and_R.title: Will both of the following occur: (1) both the United States and Israel recognize the Islamic Emirate of Afghanistan before 2030, and (2) Saudi Arabia normalize relations with Israel by 2031 if Iran does not get a nuclear bomb by then?
P_and_Q_and_R.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question will resolve positively if both of the following occur:
(1) Before 01-01-2030, reliable media sources report that both the United States of America and Israel have recognized the Islamic Emirate of Afghanistan.
(2) If the Iran nuke question resolves negatively (i.e. the Iranian Regime credibly states it has a nuclear weapon or a weapon test, as judged by media reports), then this question will resolve positively if at least five reliable media outlets report that the State of Israel is legally recognized by the Kingdom of Saudi Arabia before 2031-01-01, and negatively otherwise. Recognition is generally considered valid if it is declared by law, or declared through a large international body such as the United Nations. If the Iran nuke question resolves positively or ambiguously, this question resolves ambiguously.

P.title: Will US greenhouse gas emissions be halved by 2030?
P.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question resolves positively if there is any year between 2022 and 2030 (inclusive) in which the US levels of economy-wide net greenhouse gas emissions (in terms of CO₂ equivalents) is at least 50.00% lower than 2005 levels, according to a reliable source that is not heavily disputed by other reliable sources. The question resolves negatively if all reliable reports (that Metaculus users can find) say that the US net emissions in each year between 2022 and 2030 were greater than 50% of 2005 levels, and there is at least one reliable report about net emission levels in 2030. (If there is no report about net emission levels in 2030, we should wait for one rather than resolving this question ambiguously.)
If the US gains or loses territories between now and 2030, ideally only the net emissions from the current territories should be considered

Q_given_P.title: Given US greenhouse gas emissions are halved by 2030, will commercial animal farming be prohibited in the US before 2041?
Q_given_P.body:
Resolution Criteria for P:
This question resolves positively if there is any year between 2022 and 2030 (inclusive) in which the US levels of economy-wide net greenhouse gas emissions (in terms of CO₂ equivalents) is at least 50.00% lower than 2005 levels, according to a reliable source that is not heavily disputed by other reliable sources. The question resolves negatively if all reliable reports (that Metaculus users can find) say that the US net emissions in each year between 2022 and 2030 were greater than 50% of 2005 levels, and there is at least one reliable report about net emission levels in 2030. (If there is no report about net emission levels in 2030, we should wait for one rather than resolving this question ambiguously.)
If the US gains or loses territories between now and 2030, ideally only the net emissions from the current territories should be considered.

Resolution Criteria for Q:
This question will resolve as Yes if the US government passes legislation or the US constitution has been amended or interpreted by the Supreme Court to prohibit commercial animal farming before December 31, 2040.
Fine Print
Commercial Animal farming is considered to be the branch of agriculture involving animals that are raised for the commerce of meat, fibre, milk, eggs, or other physical products. For example, dairy cows should count as animal farming, but not pet chickens or animals kept in zoos for entertainment purposes. Both aquaculture (fish-farming) and fishing for wild fish should also count for resolution of this question.

R_given_P_and_Q.title: If US greenhouse gas emissions are halved by 2030 and commercial animal farming is prohibited in the US before 2041, will Republicans hold the Senate from 2022 to 2030 if Washington DC and Puerto Rico are not admitted as new states?
R_given_P_and_Q.body:
Resolution Criteria for Condition:
This question resolves positively if both of the following occur:
(a) There is any year between 2022 and 2030 (inclusive) in which the US levels of economy-wide net greenhouse gas emissions (in terms of CO₂ equivalents) is at least 50.00% lower than 2005 levels, according to a reliable source that is not heavily disputed by other reliable sources. The question resolves negatively if all reliable reports (that Metaculus users can find) say that the US net emissions in each year between 2022 and 2030 were greater than 50% of 2005 levels, and there is at least one reliable report about net emission levels in 2030. (If there is no report about net emission levels in 2030, we should wait for one rather than resolving this question ambiguously.) If the US gains or loses territories between now and 2030, ideally only the net emissions from the current territories should be considered.
(b) The US government passes legislation or the US constitution has been amended or interpreted by the Supreme Court to prohibit commercial animal farming before December 31, 2040.

Resolution Criteria for Outcome:
This question will resolve as Yes if:
Both Washington DC and Puerto Rico are not officially admitted as new states before December 31, 2029, and
the Republican Party controls the Senate from the beginning of the congressional term in 2023 to the end of the congressional term in 2031 (the 118th through 121st congresses, inclusive).
If Republicans do not control the Senate at any point during that period, this question will resolve as No. If both Washington DC and Puerto Rico are officially admitted to the United States on or before December 31, 2029, this question will resolve as Ambiguous.

P_and_Q_and_R.title: Will US greenhouse gas emissions be halved by 2030, will commercial animal farming be prohibited in the US before 2041, and if Washington DC and Puerto Rico are not admitted as new states, will Republicans hold the Senate from 2022 to 2030?
P_and_Q_and_R.body:
Resolution Criteria
This question resolves positively if all of the following occur:
(a) There is any year between 2022 and 2030 (inclusive) in which the US levels of economy-wide net greenhouse gas emissions (in terms of CO₂ equivalents) is at least 50.00% lower than 2005 levels, according to a reliable source that is not heavily disputed by other reliable sources. The question resolves negatively if all reliable reports (that Metaculus users can find) say that the US net emissions in each year between 2022 and 2030 were greater than 50% of 2005 levels, and there is at least one reliable report about net emission levels in 2030. (If there is no report about net emission levels in 2030, we should wait for one rather than resolving this question ambiguously.) If the US gains or loses territories between now and 2030, ideally only the net emissions from the current territories should be considered.
(b) The US government passes legislation or the US constitution has been amended or interpreted by the Supreme Court to prohibit commercial animal farming before December 31, 2040.
(c) Both Washington DC and Puerto Rico are not officially admitted as new states before December 31, 2029, and the Republican Party controls the Senate from the beginning of the congressional term in 2023 to the end of the congressional term in 2031 (the 118th through 121st congresses, inclusive). If Republicans do not control the Senate at any point during that period, this question will resolve as No. If both Washington DC and Puerto Rico are officially admitted to the United States on or before December 31, 2029, this question will resolve as Ambiguous.
Fine Print
Commercial Animal farming is considered to be the branch of agriculture involving animals that are raised for the commerce of meat, fibre, milk, eggs, or other physical products. For example, dairy cows should count as animal farming, but not pet chickens or animals kept in zoos for entertainment purposes. Both aquaculture (fish-farming) and fishing for wild fish should also count for resolution of this question.

P.title: Will a new amendment to the US Constitution be ratified by 2050?
P.body:
Resolution Criteria
The US Constitution has been amended 27 times in its history, most recently in 1992. This question resolves positively if at least five reliable media outlets report that before January 1st 2050 the US constitution received a 28th amendment. Otherwise it resolves negatively.
This question will close and resolve 1 hour before any 28th amendment becomes law, if one does.

Q_given_P.title: Conditional on a new amendment to the US Constitution being ratified by 2050, will the United States continue to be among the 20 countries with the largest deterioration in state stability over the 2019-2029 period, according to the Fragile States Index?
Q_given_P.body:
Resolution Criteria for P:
The US Constitution has been amended 27 times in its history, most recently in 1992. This question resolves positively if at least five reliable media outlets report that before January 1st 2050 the US constitution received a 28th amendment. Otherwise it resolves negatively.
This question will close and resolve 1 hour before any 28th amendment becomes law, if one does.

Resolution Criteria for Q:
The Fragile State Index is an important metric of government stability. It is published every year here.
According to the 2019 report (see page 11), over the 2009 to 2019 period, The US was #12 among the countries with the most rapidly deteriorating Fragile States Index. The US was still among the more stable nations in the world but the trend was clearly in the direction of less stability.
Will the United States continue to be among the 20 countries with the largest deterioration in state stability over the 2019-2029 period, according to the Fragile States Index?
This question resolves positively if the United States is amongst the 20 countries with the largest long-term increase (worsening) of fragile state score over the 2019-2029 period.
If for some reason, Fund for Peace ceases to publish this index, or their index can no longer be compared historically this question will be ambiguous, unless the Fund For Peace designates a successor index that also shows which 20 countries have deteriorated the most over the period 2019 to 2029 from a standpoint of stability.
If the United States ceases to exist as a unified nation this question resolves positive.

R_given_P_and_Q.title: Conditional on both a new amendment to the US Constitution being ratified by 2050 and the United States continuing to be among the 20 countries with the largest deterioration in state stability over the 2019-2029 period, will the Second Amendment of the United States Constitution be amended or repealed before 2025?
R_given_P_and_Q.body:
Resolution Criteria for P:
(a) A new amendment to the US Constitution be ratified by 2050:
The US Constitution has been amended 27 times in its history, most recently in 1992. This question resolves positively if at least five reliable media outlets report that before January 1st 2050 the US constitution received a 28th amendment. Otherwise it resolves negatively.
This question will close and resolve 1 hour before any 28th amendment becomes law, if one does.

(b) The United States continue to be among the 20 countries with the largest deterioration in state stability over the 2019-2029 period, according to the Fragile States Index:
The Fragile State Index is an important metric of government stability. It is published every year here.
According to the 2019 report (see page 11), over the 2009 to 2019 period, The US was #12 among the countries with the most rapidly deteriorating Fragile States Index. The US was still among the more stable nations in the world but the trend was clearly in the direction of less stability.
Will the United States continue to be among the 20 countries with the largest deterioration in state stability over the 2019-2029 period, according to the Fragile States Index?
This question resolves positively if the United States is amongst the 20 countries with the largest long-term increase (worsening) of fragile state score over the 2019-2029 period.
If for some reason, Fund for Peace ceases to publish this index, or their index can no longer be compared historically this question will be ambiguous, unless the Fund For Peace designates a successor index that also shows which 20 countries have deteriorated the most over the period 2019 to 2029 from a standpoint of stability.
If the United States ceases to exist as a unified nation this question resolves positive.

Resolution Criteria for Q:
This question will resolve as Yes if, at any time between January 1, 2019 to January 1, 2025, the Second Amendment is repealed, amended, or modified in any way through the procedure in Article Five of the US Constitution.

P_and_Q_and_R.title: Will all of the following occur: (a) a new amendment to the US Constitution be ratified by 2050, (b) the United States continue to be among the 20 countries with the largest deterioration in state stability over the 2019-2029 period, according to the Fragile States Index, and (c) the Second Amendment of the United States Constitution be amended or repealed before 2025?
P_and_Q_and_R.body:
Resolution Criteria
(a) A new amendment to the US Constitution be ratified by 2050:
The US Constitution has been amended 27 times in its history, most recently in 1992. This question resolves positively if at least five reliable media outlets report that before January 1st 2050 the US constitution received a 28th amendment. Otherwise it resolves negatively.
This question will close and resolve 1 hour before any 28th amendment becomes law, if one does.

(b) The United States continue to be among the 20 countries with the largest deterioration in state stability over the 2019-2029 period, according to the Fragile States Index:
The Fragile State Index is an important metric of government stability. It is published every year here.
According to the 2019 report (see page 11), over the 2009 to 2019 period, The US was #12 among the countries with the most rapidly deteriorating Fragile States Index. The US was still among the more stable nations in the world but the trend was clearly in the direction of less stability.
Will the United States continue to be among the 20 countries with the largest deterioration in state stability over the 2019-2029 period, according to the Fragile States Index?
This question resolves positively if the United States is amongst the 20 countries with the largest long-term increase (worsening) of fragile state score over the 2019-2029 period.
If for some reason, Fund for Peace ceases to publish this index, or their index can no longer be compared historically this question will be ambiguous, unless the Fund For Peace designates a successor index that also shows which 20 countries have deteriorated the most over the period 2019 to 2029 from a standpoint of stability.
If the United States ceases to exist as a unified nation this question resolves positive.

(c) The Second Amendment of the United States Constitution be amended or repealed before 2025:
This question will resolve as Yes if, at any time between January 1, 2019 to January 1, 2025, the Second Amendment is repealed, amended, or modified in any way through the procedure in Article Five of the US Constitution.
